statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Iona 72, Niagara 66
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. -- Sean Armand came off the bench to score 15 points and Mike Glover had 10 points and 17 rebounds as the Gaels held off Niagara 72-66 on Friday night for their fifth straight win. Iona (13-6, 7-1 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) led 33-27 at the half, then Glover and Kyle Smyth opened the second half with layups to increase the lead to 10 points. The Purple Eagles (4-16, 1-7) then launched a 15-5 run, including three 3-pointers to tie it at 42, but could get no closer. Armand answered with three consecutive 3s in a span of 1:04 to give Iona a nine-point lead with 13:30 to go. After Niagara got within two points, at 59-57 with 5:40 left, the Gaels pulled away with a 5-0 run. Iona then hit 8 of 8 from the free-throw line in the final 1:02 to seal the win. Eric Williams had 18 points and Anthony Nelson 17 for the Purple Eagles, who have lost three in a row.
